data.text:
Play Clue Of The Day

Clue of the Day

SPEECHMAKING

IN 1735 ATTORNEY ANDREW HAMILTON SPOKE IN DEFENSE OF FREEDOM OF THE PRESS AT THIS MAN'S TRIAL

Know the correct response?

If you have a MyJeopardy! profile and would like to save your response, sign in.

If you have a MyJeopardy! profile and would like to save your response, go right ahead.

Previous Clues

HORRORS!

THE TITLE OF THIS 1962 RAY BRADBURY NOVEL IS A SHAKESPEARE LINE THAT RHYMES WITH "BY THE PRICKING OF MY THUMBS"

Correct Response

WHAT IS "SOMETHING WICKED THIS WAY COMES"?

LOST WORKS

IN THE LOST ANCIENT EPIC "AETHIOPIS", THE ETHIOPIAN KING MEMNON FIGHTS FOR TROY & IS KILLED BY THIS GREEK HERO

Correct Response

WHO IS ACHILLES?

MEMORIALS & MONUMENTS

DEDICATED TO THE MEMORY OF GREAT FRENCHMEN, IT'S THE FINAL RESTING PLACE OF WOMEN TOO, INCLUDING MARIE CURIE & SIMONE VEIL

Correct Response

WHAT IS THE PANTHEON?

17th CENTURY WRITING

IN HIS 1624 HISTORY OF VIRGINIA & NEW ENGLAND, HE INCLUDED THE FAMOUS STORY OF HIS RESCUE

Correct Response

WHO IS JOHN SMITH?

PROSE & CONGRESS

IN 2011 THIS SENATOR PUBLISHED HIS "THE SPEECH: A HISTORIC FILIBUSTER ON CORPORATE GREED & THE DECLINE OF OUR MIDDLE CLASS"

Correct Response

WHO IS BERNIE SANDERS?
